Class TicTacToe

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicTacToe

  • class TicTacToe
extends java.lang.Object
    TicTacToe checks if the game is still running and sets the gameboard.

    Sets the given gameboard sizes, intialize gameboard, prints gameboard, keep tracking if there is a winner or if the gameboard is full.

    Since:
    1.6
    Version:
    2017.1209
    Author:
    Ville-Veikko Nieminen

      • setHowManytoWin

        public static void setHowManytoWin(java.lang.String x)
        Sets the amount of chars to win.

        checks if the given amount of characters in line order to win is valid. Max value is bigger value from heigth and width.

        Parameters:
        x - given amount of characters in line order to win in String.

      • getHowManytoWin

        public static int getHowManytoWin()
        Returns the amount of char needed to win.
        Returns:
        How many character must be in line to win.

      • whoWins

        public static java.lang.String whoWins()
        Checks that who is the winner.

        Checks who is the winner and then returns the String about it. If there is no winner then returns tie.

        Returns:
        Returns the string about who wins.
